# triptych-poc
Python implementation of Triptych for short linkable ring signatures on Bitcoin keys

Intended to be usable as an API, but currently WIP and only has a simple test (`test.py`).

Sample output of running the test:

```
(jmvenv) a@b:~/code/gk14-ringsig-poc$python test.py 3 4 "hello"
got this index for the signer:  62
Got hash challenge:  48045016013440932398502184124791574642140312631272789616078477375059911068799
Signing took: 0.48889613151550293 seconds.
... now verifying
Got hash challenge:  48045016013440932398502184124791574642140312631272789616078477375059911068799
It verified, for the message:  hello
Verifying took: 0.36076784133911133 seconds.
Here is the raw signature: 

It has length:  748
Here is the base64 encoded signature:

and here is the key image: 
029a0cb4f847b55d2460428e16be2daaddcf1b766c661ff283c7475949523ab977
The signature's length is 1000 bytes, in base64, for 81 keys.
```

We can see that for a small-ish ring size the verification time even in this inefficient Python code is sub 1 second, but for larger ring sizes the verify and compute time increase ~ linearly.
